title: Revision & Proofreading
description: Test your knowledge of editing levels, revision strategies, and quality assurance processes.

questions.stem: Which editing level focuses on overall document organization and content completeness?
questions.rationale: Structural editing (substantive editing) addresses organization, logic, and content completeness.

questions.stem: Match each editing level with its primary focus:
questions.rationale: Each editing level addresses specific aspects of document quality in a systematic approach.

questions.stem: What is the main purpose of line editing?
questions.rationale: Line editing focuses on improving clarity, tone, and readability at the sentence and paragraph level.

questions.stem: ________ is the final editing level that focuses on catching surface errors and formatting issues.
questions.rationale: Proofreading is the final review for surface errors, formatting, and layout consistency.

questions.stem: Which editing tasks belong to copy editing?

options.label: Correcting grammar, punctuation, and ensuring style consistency

questions.rationale: Copy editing addresses grammar, punctuation, spelling, and style consistency.

questions.stem: What is the benefit of the 'multiple pass' revision strategy?

options.label: It saves time by combining all editing levels
It allows focused attention on different aspects each time
It eliminates the need for checklists
It can be done immediately after writing

questions.rationale: Multiple pass strategy allows focused attention on different aspects (content, style, grammar, format) in separate reviews.

questions.stem: The '________ eyes' technique involves taking breaks between writing and revising for better objectivity.
questions.rationale: Fresh eyes technique uses time gaps and different perspectives to improve objectivity in revision.

questions.stem: Why is reverse reading (reading from end to beginning) useful for proofreading?

options.label: It helps catch spelling errors and formatting issues

questions.rationale: Reverse reading disrupts normal reading patterns, making spelling errors and formatting inconsistencies more visible.

questions.stem: What should specialized checklists be developed for?
questions.rationale: Specialized checklists should be developed for different document types to address their specific requirements.

questions.stem: Identify what's wrong with this revision approach:
questions.text: I always revise my documents immediately after writing while the content is fresh in my mind, checking for all types of errors at once.

errors.text: all types of errors at once
errors.correction: different types of errors in separate passes
errors.reason: Should focus on one type of error per pass

questions.rationale: Effective revision requires time gaps for objectivity and focused passes for different types of errors.

questions.stem: What is the primary advantage of audio proofreading (text-to-speech)?

options.label: It helps identify awkward phrasing and missing words
It replaces the need for human review

questions.rationale: Audio proofreading helps identify issues that might be missed visually, like awkward phrasing and missing words.

questions.stem: When verifying numerical data during proofreading, what should you do?

options.label: Trust the spell-checker to catch errors
Cross-reference with source materials and verify calculations
Only check numbers that look suspicious

questions.rationale: All numerical data should be verified against sources and calculations should be checked independently.

questions.stem: Character-level review focuses on finding ________ errors that automated tools might miss.
questions.rationale: Character-level review catches typography errors like transposed letters, wrong quotation marks, and spacing issues.

questions.stem: What should be included in reference validation during proofreading?

options.label: Citations, web links, page numbers, and cross-references

questions.rationale: Reference validation includes checking all citations, web links, page numbers, and cross-references for accuracy.

questions.stem: What is a limitation of automated proofreading tools?

options.label: They may miss context-dependent errors and specialized terminology
They only work with short documents

questions.rationale: Automated tools have limitations with context-dependent errors, specialized terminology, and organizational style preferences.

questions.stem: Which of these is a frequent spelling error in government documents?
questions.rationale: 'Accommodate' is frequently misspelled as 'accomodate' - remember it has two c's and two m's.

questions.stem: Find the grammar error:
questions.text: The committee have reviewed all applications and is making their final decisions.

errors.reason: Inconsistent - if using 'their' (plural), verb should be 'are'

questions.rationale: Maintain consistent subject-verb agreement - 'committee' can be singular or plural but must be consistent throughout.

questions.stem: What type of error is this: 'The policy effects all employees'?
questions.rationale: Should be 'affects' (verb) not 'effects' (noun) - 'The policy affects all employees.'

questions.stem: Which represents a Canadian-specific formatting issue to check?

options.label: Currency symbol placement and metric unit spacing

questions.rationale: Canadian documents require attention to currency format ($25 not 25$) and proper metric spacing (25 kg not 25kg).

questions.stem: A ________ error log helps editors track their common mistakes and develop personalized prevention strategies.
questions.rationale: Personal error logs help identify patterns in individual mistakes for targeted improvement.

questions.stem: What should be done with all statistical data during technical verification?

options.label: Cross-reference with sources and verify calculations independently
Only check data that seems unusual

questions.rationale: All statistical data must be cross-referenced with original sources and calculations verified independently.

questions.stem: Why is legal and regulatory accuracy particularly important?

options.label: Inaccurate legal information can mislead citizens and create liability
It's more complex than other content

questions.rationale: Inaccurate legal information can mislead citizens, cause compliance failures, and create legal liability.

questions.stem: Technical terminology should be verified against ________ sources and industry-specific dictionaries.
questions.rationale: Technical terms must be verified against authoritative sources to ensure accuracy and proper usage.

questions.stem: What should be included in web content verification?

options.label: Testing links, verifying external site reliability, and confirming contact information

questions.rationale: Web content verification includes testing functionality, verifying reliability, and confirming all digital contact information.

questions.stem: Put the technical accuracy workflow steps in order:
items: Source verification - check against original sources
Expert review - have specialists verify accuracy
questions.rationale: Technical accuracy follows a systematic workflow from identification through expert validation to final confirmation.

questions.stem: What is the primary benefit of using comprehensive checklists during revision?

options.label: They replace the need for expertise

questions.rationale: Comprehensive checklists ensure systematic coverage of all important review aspects, preventing oversight.

questions.stem: Which category should be checked first when using the master checklist?
questions.rationale: Content and structure should be reviewed first, as major structural changes can affect other elements.

questions.stem: The master checklist should be used ________ to track progress and ensure nothing is missed.
questions.rationale: Systematic use of checklists ensures consistent, thorough coverage of all review elements.

questions.stem: What should you verify about graphics and tables?

options.label: They support text, have captions, and are properly referenced

questions.rationale: Graphics must support the text, have appropriate captions, be referenced in text, and be accessible.

questions.stem: Why should checklist progress be tracked?

options.label: To ensure complete coverage and identify areas needing attention

questions.rationale: Progress tracking ensures complete coverage of all checklist items and helps identify areas needing more attention.

questions.stem: What is the first step in the pre-publication review sequence?
questions.rationale: Final content review comes first to ensure the document reads coherently and meets its purpose.

questions.stem: What should be tested during the format and layout check?

options.label: Print layout, accessibility features, and brand compliance

questions.rationale: Format and layout check includes print layout, accessibility features, and compliance with brand/style guidelines.

questions.stem: The ________ standard ensures all factual information is verified and calculations confirmed.
questions.rationale: The accuracy standard focuses on verifying factual information, calculations, and technical content.

questions.stem: What should be documented as part of the review process?

options.label: Checklist completion, reviewers, changes made, and approvals

questions.rationale: Complete review documentation includes checklists, reviewers, changes made, approvals, and version control.

questions.stem: What indicates a document is ready for professional distribution?

options.label: All quality standards are met and approvals obtained

questions.rationale: Distribution readiness requires meeting all quality standards (completeness, accuracy, presentation, communication) and obtaining proper approvals.
